alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Boyle; Clark; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Madison; Marion; Mercer; Nicholas; Woodford (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:46AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Garrard, Clark, southeastern Marion, Jessamine, southern Nicholas, northern Casey, Lincoln, eastern Mercer, central Woodford, Bourbon, Boyle, Madison and Fayette Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 146 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Versailles to 9 miles northwest of Liberty. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Versailles around 150 AM EDT. Cardinal Hill, Dunbar High School and Fayette Mall around 155 AM EDT. Lexington, Highlands, Meadowthorpe, Northland, Thoroughbred Acres, U K Arboretum and Chevy Chase around 200 AM EDT. Bryan Station around 205 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Stanford, Paris, Lancaster and Carlisle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bourbon; Boyle; Clark; Fayette; Garrard; Jessamine; Madison; Marion; Mercer; Nicholas; Woodford
